songs.title: A Message from Yasiin Bey [via Kanye West]
songs.lyrics: Ain't home arrest, I don't need to stay<endline>I'll leave and I'll stay away<endline>I committed no crime any place<endline>Why these police up in my face?<endline>Why they raiding my place?<endline>Why I don't feel safe?<endline>This is not an expression of fear<endline>This is just to make things clear<endline>My intentions are pure in coming here<endline>And that's for everything I love or hold dear<endline>Umi's in the building<endline>So is my wife and my children<endline>I committed no crime<endline>Why is the state wasting my time?<endline>They must be out of their minds<endline>I forgive 'em, that's the spirit of divine<endline>I just wanna go where I'm wanted<endline>Where I'm loved, stop frontin'<endline>Where I live is my choice, you cannot mute my voice<endline>Thank you, Kanye West, for being a real friend, a real friend<endline>A real friend<endline><endline>I heard your choice the first time, I'll go away<endline>And when I leave, that's exactly where I'll stay<endline>This is not an expression of fear<endline>This is just to make things clear<endline>A country called Earth, everywhere<endline>A country called Earth, everywhere<endline><endline>The state of South Africa has interfered with my ability to move or to even fulfill my professional obligations unnecessarily. And that's fine; we don't have to be enemies and we don't have to be friends either. My family and I are prepared, immediately, to make whatever move that we need to make outside of this state, never to return to this state again. We don't have to be here. We're not pining to be here, and we’re complying in every possible way, reasonably. Just today, state officials visited my domicile asking questions about me and my family, and they had no right to do so. I have legal representation here who they could easily contact. They're contravening and breaking all types of international law, and it's untenable for me to just sit by and just let this go on. And I know it's been a lot of chatter about what's going on, you know, people are running to the press, because that's just…you know, a money making machine. So, it’s another exploitative measure to turn this into some soap opera, some tele-novella, and I have no interest in it. Furthermore, related but not directly related to this: I'm retiring from the music recording industry as it is currently assembled today, and also from Hollywood, effective immediately. I am releasing my final album this year. Um…and that's that<endline><endline>Peace to all, fear of none. Thank everyone for their time. Much success to you, even if you wish me the opposite, as Nas said. And I'm on the side of the right, so people could wish however they want, but I ain't nobody's…I ain't no threat or a hazard to nobody. I really try to mind my business. What people think about me is none of my business, and I'm not here to change people's opinions about me. You don't have to like me; you don't have to like everything that I say. The fact is, is that I have hurt no one. I have injured no parties, and all I require, as is my lawful right, is innocent passage to my domicile. That is all<endline><endline>In summary, I will say this, I will close with a simple prayer: To the one who has created the all, you know me better than I know myself, and I know myself better than people know me. So, forgive me for whatever they know or do not know. Make me better than whatever is said and do not make me responsible for whatever is said. Ameen, ameen, allahumma ameen<endline><endline>And I'll close for you, Ye, with the, with the verse that I kicked for you on December 31st, when you was in Atlantic City and you announced that you and Kim were having Nori. And, and, shout out to Madlib, and Otis, and…and…and Michael and his entire family, and to Mama Jackson and to the whole Jackson clan in L.A., I wish you and your family the best, your mother, you know, reach out to me, Egon, you know, y'all know how to reach. Shout out to Corey Smyth, shout out to my brother Talib Kweli, salaam to my brother Kamaal Fareed, Ali Shaheed Muhammad, Islam, all of the Zulu Nation. The Zulu Nation real here; there's real Zulus. My brother, Siyabonga, the Madlalas. All of the people here who have supported me: this is no reflection on you. I love the people of this country. I love this continent. I do not have to sit idly by and just be persecuted unfairly by a state. They waste enough of my time and... I'm through with you Felicia... we're through. I don't want nothing from you. You can keep the records, the sweatshirts, everything; it's no problem. But I'll end with this verse that I wanna put on "No More Parties in LA," if you would kindly allow me, my dear brother Kanye. And shout out to K. Lamar, too; I see you, my dude<endline>Lonely America, crazy America<endline>Loud ass, country ass, cocaine America<endline>Lethal America, carcinogen, asthma<endline>Carbonated smoke throughout your blood plasma<endline>Lights and camera, action, surveillance<endline>Helicopters, teleprompters<endline>Flossy newscasters, rich, fool, bastards<endline>War, migrant workers, cold murder, traffic<endline>Welcome to Los... stop right there<endline>Biggie got shot right here<endline>Angeles<endline>Hollywood, hoes, handguns<endline><endline>Peace to all, fear none. This is Bey. Love. One

songs.title: An Open Letter From Mos Def
songs.lyrics: An Open Letter From Mos Def<endline>By Mos Def<endline>February 1999<endline><endline>An Open letter From Mos Def...<endline>Diallo was a West African immigrant with no prior criminal record who was shot and killed by police in the dark of night for simply being black. He was unarmed and shot at 41 times! No unarmed man should be shot at even once! One of the police officers involved in the Diallo shooting was involved in the killing of Patrick Bailey no more than a year and a half ago! Tyesha Miller was shot in her car in Los Angeles while she had a seizure! I could go on and on with the names of black people who have been killed at the hands of police just this year. But the list is so long that it would turn this letter into a statistic sheet.<endline><endline>Most of the people that got killed by police this year and in the past have probably been some of your fans; fans of some of your favorite artists. They are black people who love us, who defend us, who protect us, who put us in our comfortable homes an dour luxury sports utility vehicles and our well kept hotels suites and our oversized tour buses. They're the people that buy our records, our t-shirts, our concert tickets, and so on, and so forth. They're the same people that are getting murdered, harassed, maimed, and beaten in streets all over the world everyday!<endline><endline>The only people in our community who have not responded to this incident are us. Hip-Hop made one hundred billion dollars last year!... A lot of those dollars came from the 'Comptoms', the 'Brooklyns', the 'Crown Heights', the 'Chicagos', the Detroit ghettos, the St. Louis ghettos... the same ghettos where police run around literally hunting black folks to murder... then cruise the streets shortly thereafter with impunity and arrogance.<endline><endline>We are the Senators and the Congressmen of our communities. We come from communities that don't have nobody to speak for them. That's why they love us. Because we talk about what nobody else will talk about. We represent them. And they need to know that we really represent them. Not when it's just a romantic notion or a paycheck attached to it. When something happens to them it matters to us, because when something happens to them it's happening to us. Because Amadou Diallo is your brother, your cousin, your man... Tyesha Miller is your sister, your aunt, your girl, your wife, your daughter... All of these people are you! You are no different! And just because we're at the top of the Billboard charts, seen on MTV daily, livin' comfortably doesn't mean that we can't get shot, we can't be harassed, we can't be maimed and mistreated.<endline><endline>I hope this is as important to you as it is to me cause when I pass by the projects and when I pass by the hood I don't see nobody but me. I see everybody who looks like me. I see me many years ago as I'm sure many of you do. So it's time for us to come together from the 'jiggy' to the 'hardcore'; from the 'backpacker' to the man with the Lexus and really unite and show the world that we got strength. Show the world who we are. Represent who we are. Who we really are and where we really come from. Let's show people where our heart is... that we haven't forgotten.<endline><endline>Now I'm askin' you and anybody who looks on this letter to come forward and show your heart, to show your love, to love the people who love you back by speaking out against the injustices that they suffer. Because believe me, if the clock was turned backwards we'd be those same people.<endline><endline>Please stay mindful of this. Please be considerate of this letter. Pass it around! Talk about this! Think about it! Keep it on your mind because if you don't... it's going to keep its mind on you.<endline><endline>I wanna thank everybody for taking time out to read this letter. I hope I didn't take up too much of your time. All of the contact information and other information you need to know is enclosed.<endline><endline>I want to wish everybody, each and everyone of ya'll peace, prosperity and love.<endline><endline>Peace,<endline>Mos Def

songs.title: Auditorium
songs.lyrics: The way I feel, sometimes it's too hard to sit still<endline>Things are so passionate, times are so real<endline>Sometimes I try and chill, mellow down, blowin' smoke<endline>Smile on my face but it's really no joke<endline>You feel it in the street, the people breathe without hope<endline>They goin' through the motion, they dimmin' down the focus<endline>The focus get cleared then the light turn sharp<endline>And the eyes go teary, the mind grow weary<endline>I speak it so clearly sometimes y'all don't hear me<endline>I push it past the bass, know nations gotta feel me<endline>I feel it in my bones, black I'm so wide awake<endline>That I hardly ever sleep, my flow forever deep<endline>And it's volumes or scriptures when I breathe on a beat<endline>My presence speak volumes before I say a word<endline>I'm everywhere: penthouse, pavement and curb<endline>Cradle to the grave, tall cathedral or a cell<endline>Universal ghetto life, holla black you know it well<endline>Quiet storm, vital form, pen pushed it right across<endline>Mind is a vital force, high level right across<endline>Soul is the lion's roar, voice is the siren<endline>I swing round, ring out, and bring down the tyrant<endline>Shocked a small act could knock a giant lopsided<endline>The world is so dangerous, there's no need for fightin'<endline>Suckas trying to hide like the struggle won't find 'em<endline>Then the sun bust through the clouds to clearly remind him<endline>Everywhere penthouse pavement and curb<endline>Cradle to the grave, tall cathedral or a cell<endline>Universal ghetto life, holla black you know it well<endline><endline>

songs.title: Breakdown
songs.lyrics: YO!<endline><endline>Good evening ladies and gents, close and distant fam<endline>Let me break it down for ya'll exactly who I am...(CAV)<endline>That brotha straight off of Myrtle Ave<endline>That dude that make the other dude say that's my man, (CAV)<endline>It ain't nuttin' I want I can't have<endline>The haters know it's real and that's why they mad<endline>They struggle so hard while I just lay back<endline>They sound under pressure, sweaty and straight wack<endline>I rock like this because I ain't that, (CAV)<endline>Tell the players I'm taking the game back...<endline>Matta fact tell the coaches, the GMs, and owners<endline>Shut down the stadiums, it's over<endline>I make the cat's in the back draw closer<endline>Get the comp choked up like white folks on Oprah<endline>Yeah you dope, but (CAV) it's more doper<endline>More skill, more style, and more focus<endline>I hit the lab with good shit to smoke up<endline>And tell the sound man where I wanna go from<endline>Blow up, skit sheet across the notepad<endline>School em' all from the drop out to post grads<endline>What history book you do or don't have<endline>There's only two eras of rap, pre and post CAV<endline>Now you know that<endline>Stop the train, there's no place for the game left to go at<endline><endline>Holla!!...Like Missy and Ja Rule<endline>Ain't a crowd in the world that CAV cannot move<endline>Hot dude, cats was thinkin' it's not true<endline>But come front row at the show, I got proof<endline>I went from sellin' candy in junior high school<endline>To servin' spoony g for the fiends to gnaw to<endline>Got sent upstate on a bus, (Not cool)<endline>In the yard thinkin' damn should've listen to ma duke<endline>Come home in 99, what the fuck I'm gonna do<endline>I won't move bundles, I got a new hustle<endline>I quit pie baking, started rhyme makin<endline>Buildin' up my rep to be one of the five greatest<endline>And I ain't saying CAV the best nigga out there<endline>But until he appear, I'm sittin' in his chair<endline>And I'mma need a few moments just to get in ya'll ear<endline>To make you forget that dude was ever even here<endline>I got two words for the world: Be prepared<endline>I got three words for your girl: Don't be scared!<endline>And when they ask where the real hip-hop, IT'S OVER HERE!<endline>And when they ask where Brooklyn at, HOLD YA EARS!<endline>It's like YEAH! Chris Antione Vashon<endline>Capricorn hit em' off with the classic bong and then I'm gone...<endline><endline>Ridin' back to Brook-Lan... boyeeeeee

Young cats stash they jums at<endline>Draw they guns back, momma screams where she sons at<endline>Tryin to hunt that, recurring dream of high stakes<endline>The fourth largest, first hardest, Brooklyn is the place<endline>Settled by the Dutch many years ago<endline>Three million strong, and here we go<endline><endline>*part two*<endline><endline>(Mos Def)<endline>GOOD MORNINNNNNNNNNGG VIETNAM!!!<endline>Ha (back up back up back up back up back up)*repeated in background*<endline>Yo sometimes I sit back, reflect on the place that I live at<endline>Unlike any place I ever been at<endline>The home of big gats, deep dish hammer rim caps<endline>Have a mishap, push ya wig back<endline>Where you go to get the fresh trim at<endline>Four on the jake got the Timb rack<endline>Blue collars metro carding it<endline>Thugs mobbin it, form partnership<endline>Increase armorment, street pharmacist<endline>Deep consequence, when you seek sleek ornaments<endline>You get caught, rode the white horse and can't get off<endline>Big dogs that trick off just get sent off<endline>They shoebox stash is all they seeds gotta live off<endline>It's real yo but still yo, it's love here<endline>And it's felt by anybody that come here<endline>Out of towners take the train, plane and bus here<endline>Must be something that they really want here<endline>One year as a resident, deepest sentiment<endline>They shout out, "Go Brooklyn!", they representin it<endline>Sittin on they front stoop sippin Guinesses<endline>Usin native dialect in they sentences<endline>From the treeline blocks to the tenaments<endline>To the Mom & Pop local shop menaces<endline>Travel all around the world in great distances<endline>And ain't a place that I know that bear resemblance<endline>That's why we it The Planet<endline>Not a borough or a province, our style is uncommon<endline>From ?sun? to the ? to the Lafayette Gardens<endline>Wycoff, Gowanus in they army jacket linings<endline>Yo this goes out to my cats in Coney Isle<endline>Friday night out in front The Himalaya goin wild<endline>This goes out to Crown Heights and Smurv Village<endline>The nighties, and all my ?yarda trenny? Brown's Village<endline>Parkside tennis court, thirties, forties, and the fifties<endline>The cats out in Starrett City gettin busy<endline>To the Hook, to the East, to the Stuy<endline>Bushwick and Canarsie, Farragut, Fort Green, and Marcy<endline>My Flatbush posse, generals of armies<endline>When it's time to form, just call me<endline>And let this song be, playin loud in Long B<endline>If you love Bucktown STRONGLY!<endline>RAISE IT UP!<endline><endline>*part three*<endline><endline>(Mos Def)<endline>Brooklyn my habitat, the place where it happen at<endline>Live sway and the sharp balance of the battle axe<endline>Irons is brandished at, thugs draw they hammer back<endline>It's where you find the News 2 crew cameras at<endline>It's where my fam is at, summertime jam is at<endline>They play Big and get you open like a sandal back<endline>Hotter than candle wax, hustlin you can't relax<endline>The crack babies tryin to find where they mamma's at<endline>It's off the handle black, wit big police scandals that<endline>Turn into actions screenplays sold to Miramax<endline>The type of place where they check your appearance at<endline>And cats who know where all the hot 'lo gear is at<endline>The stompin grounds, where you find a pound smokers that<endline>Be blazin charm that have your wig cap floatin back<endline>The doorstep where the disposessed posted at<endline>Dope fiends out at Franklin Ave sellin zovarax<endline>You big ballin better keep your money folded back<endline>Cuz once the young guns notice that it's over, black<endline>Brooklyn keep on takin it, worldwide we known for that<endline>Flossy cats get it snatched like the local tax<endline>The place I sharpen up my baritone vocals at<endline>Where one of the greatest MC's was a local cat

songs.title: Brown Sugar (Extra Sweet)
songs.lyrics: [Mos Def (Faith Evans) {other person}]<endline>Woo, Ah, Official, Official, Ah, {Oh oh oh oh oh}<endline>Brown Sugar, Faith Evans, Big Mos {Oh oh oh oh, OH} (Wha what)<endline>Brooklyn is in the building, hell we own the building (Wha What)<endline>Heh, y'all just payin' rent, see I'm sayin'? {Oh oh oh oh oh, Oh oh oh oh oh}<endline><endline>Listen, now honey check it out ya got me mesmerized<endline>With your black hair and your fat ass thighs<endline>It's the way I hold it down to make my nature rise<endline>You got me in the boutiques pickin' out your size<endline>You make the push and I can't get it out my mind<endline>It's that body I can't get it out my mind<endline>Give it up ma, know it that your down to ride<endline>Hit the dance floor and bounce your hide<endline>You got to bounce with mine<endline>And let me know when your down to slide<endline>I tell Ad to swing around to ride<endline>Let's show you how I grind<endline>I make it splash like a thousand times<endline>I'm like the stars fallin out the sky, Big Mos<endline>Flaco make your waist get coast<endline>Make your green get smoke<endline>Make your cat get stroke<endline>Me and Pha make the track get dope<endline>We stay settin' pace in the race now let's go<endline><endline>It's like one, two, three, into the fo'<endline>Brooklyn is runnin' the show, let em know<endline>Former scramblers, my gamblers<endline>My dirty money handlers, my jugulars<endline>My hustlers, professional or amateur, woo (Give it to me)<endline>C'mon (Give it to me)<endline>I said what? (Give it to me)<endline>Uh (Give it to me)<endline>Uh, I got to get it all<endline>You got to get involved<endline>You ain't got it to give<endline>You gotta get along (Give it to me)<endline>C'mon (Give it to me)<endline>I said what? (Give it to me)<endline>Uh (Give it to me)<endline><endline>Yeah, and if you holdin' it<endline>I make you let go of it<endline>And I'm a get it<endline>'Till my getting things is over with (Uh huh)<endline>And why not love?<endline>Look what you got love<endline>You get me all charged up<endline>Expect me to stop what? songs.title: Can U C The Pride In The Panther? - Album Version (Female)

Oh<endline>Shout out to all of my crew, East-West, North-South<endline>All the continent, Europe, all abroad international<endline>Bring it in, bring it in, bring it in, bring it in<endline>It's a lot of things goin' on y'all<endline>21st century is comin'<endline>20th century almost done<endline>A lot of things have changed<endline>A lot of things have not, mainly us<endline>We gon' get it together right? I believe that<endline>Listen—people be askin' me all the time<endline>"Yo Mos, what's gettin' ready to happen with hip-hop?"<endline>(Where do you think hip-hop is goin'?)<endline>I tell em, "You know what's gonna happen with hip-hop?<endline>Whatever's happening with us"<endline>If we smoked out, hip-hop is gonna be smoked out<endline>If we doin' alright, hip-hop is gonna be doin' alright<endline>People talk about hip-hop like it's some giant livin' in the hillside<endline>Comin' down to visit the townspeople<endline>We are hip-hop<endline>Me, you, everybody, we are hip-hop<endline>So hip-hop is going where we going<endline>So the next time you ask yourself where hip-hop is going<endline>Ask yourself: where am I going? How am I doing?<endline>Till you get a clear idea<endline>So if hip-hop is about the people<endline>And the hip-hop won't get better until the people get better<endline>Then how do people get better? (Hmm)<endline>Well, from my understanding people get better<endline>When they start to understand that they are valuable<endline>And they not valuable because they got a whole lot of money<endline>Or 'cause somebody, think they sexy<endline>But they valuable 'cause they been created by God<endline>And God makes you valuable<endline>And whether or not you recognize that value is one thing<endline>You got a lot of societies and governments<endline>Tryin' to be God, wishing that they were God<endline>They wanna create satellites and cameras everywhere<endline>And make you think they got the all-seeing eye<endline>Eh, I guess The Last Poets wasn't too far off<endline>When they said that certain people got a god complex<endline>I believe it's true<endline>I don't get phased out by none of that, none of that<endline>Helicopters, the TV screens, the newscasters, the satellite dishes<endline>They just wishing<endline>They can't really never do that<endline>When they tell me to fear they law<endline>When they tell me to try to have some fret in my heart behind the things that they do<endline>This is what I think in my mind<endline>And this is what I say to them<endline>And this is what I'm saying to you check it<endline><endline>

I'm high, low, east, west, all over your map<endline>I'm getting big props, with this thing called hip hop<endline>Where you can either get paid or get shot<endline>When your product in stock, the fair-weather friends flock<endline>When your chart position drop, then the phone calls....<endline>Chill for a minute, let's see who else hot, snatch your shelf spot<endline>Don't gas yourself, akh'<endline>The industry just a better built cell block<endline>A long way from the shell tops<endline>And the bells that L rocked (rock, rock, rock, rock...)<endline><endline>Hip Hop is prosecution evidence<endline>An out of court settlement, ad space for liquor<endline>Sick without benefits (hungh!) Luxury tenements<endline>Choking the skyline, it's low life getting tree-top high<endline>It is a back water remedy<endline>Bitter and tender memory, a class E felony<endline>Facing the death penalty (hungh!)<endline>Stimulant and sedative, original repetitive<endline>Violently competitive, a school unaccredited<endline>The break beats you get broken with on time and inappropriate<endline>Hip Hop went from selling crack to smoking it<endline>Medicine for loneliness remind me of Thelonius and Dizzy<endline>Propers to B-Boys getting busy<endline>The war-time snap shot, the working man's jack-pot<endline>A two dollar snack box sold beneath the crack spot<endline>Olympic sponsor of the black Glock<endline>Gold medalist in the back shot<endline>From the sovereign state of the have-nots<endline>Where farmers have trouble with cash crops (woooo)<endline>It's all-city like Phase 2<endline>Hip Hop will simply amaze you, praise you, pay you<endline>Do whatever you say do, but, black, it can't save you

songs.title: I’m Leaving
songs.lyrics: Well go'head and leave<endline>The call heard around the world from the wives of MCs<endline>These cats is paying more than half a pound<endline>My garment bag'll snatch it down<endline>Ain't got the skate, but we can probably run it back in town<endline>Scenarios like this is tear jerkers<endline>For the modern emcee, ie. the blue collar worker<endline>Cause this thing called rhyming, no different from coal mining<endline>We both on assignment, to unearth the diamond<endline>While you start climbing in 'em, I start shining<endline>You be struggling and striving<endline>And they think you prime timing<endline>Maintain and keep silent<endline>Make note and observation<endline>This confrontation<endline>This is the daily operation<endline>My concentration<endline>Stay focused on my recitation<endline>Bout to reach my destination<endline>With no pause or hesitation<endline>Baby make the preparation<endline>Cause this ain't no recreation<endline>This is pro-ball<endline>And we lettin' you know y'all<endline>At the show y'all<endline>Doing this for dough y'all<endline>Get the phone call<endline>And I'm ready to blow y'all<endline>Bout to go y'all<endline>Been a pleasure to know y'all<endline>And I'm lettin' you know that<endline><endline>But God willing I'll be back home<endline>To drop these heavy ass bags up off my back bone<endline>Around the world with a catalogue of rap songs<endline>My baby girl is walking, been away for that long<endline>But no you haven't well at least that's how it seem to me<endline>My hometown is like a whole different scenery<endline>The old timers on the stoop leaning leisurely<endline>The new jacks up in the parks smoking greenery<endline>Easily take it for granted when you up in it<endline>But it's sweet scented, when you been down for a minute<endline>Move around city limits, break 'em down with the vinitage<endline>The inovinin', classical b-boy image<endline>Collect the winnings<endline>Cause it the reason that we came here<endline>This thing is not a game here<endline>The fortune not the fame here<endline>From New York to the Cackalacks<endline>Cali and the Cadillacs<endline>Chicago no we innovate<endline>Infiltrate Virginia state<endline>DC make me stimulate<endline>Philly know we penetrate<endline>Georgia make us generate<endline>Let's set a date to get the papes<endline>They celebrate to my jams in foreign lands<endline>Even your mans in Japan know who I am<endline>Mina-san, make everybody out in Nippon<endline>Say ichiban, me God man bo where you hitting from<endline>Phenomenon<endline>Scuse me that's a phone call<endline>It's a show y'all<endline>Trying to get this dough y'all<endline>Bout to blow y'all<endline>Been a pleasure to know y'all<endline>And I'm lettin' you know<endline><endline>Shake your money maker<endline>Shake your money maker<endline>Shake your money maker<endline>Move your money maker<endline>Move your money maker

songs.title: Invisible Game
songs.lyrics: Before Mr. Taylor taught the world to play<endline>Before fiberglass<endline>Before parquet<endline>Before the word "Doctor" was spelled with a "J"<endline>And ballrooms were ballcourts where the Renaissance played<endline>Before the hype and before the dunk<endline>After the rhythm but before the funk<endline>Before the money and before the fame<endline>Before new school and old school<endline>Before school had a name<endline>It was only a ball and the soul of the game<endline>The First School<endline>Converse

songs.title: I’ve Committed Murder
songs.lyrics: My baby works down at the boulevard café<endline>Just a fine young man with big dreams<endline>Trying to make his own way<endline>The owner is this man ole bitch who degrades<endline>Him everyday<endline>Then she fires him for no reason<endline>Don't wanna give him for no reason<endline>I've committed murder and I think I got away<endline>I'm hiding at my mother's house come get me right away<endline>Right away<endline>I have no intention of paying for my crimes don't fear<endline>We're gonna get the next plane outta here and fly away<endline>Fly away<endline><endline>When he's down it breaks my heart to see him<endline>So I figured I'd talk to her woman to woman<endline>I walk in and she's countin her cash<endline>Got so much cash her office looks like a green pasture<endline>I said, "Give him the little bit of money you owe him"<endline>She said "Get back bitch I ain't givin you shit"<endline>I said, "You ole bag, maybe you ain't heard but them are fightin words"<endline>I've committed murder and I think I got away<endline>I'm hiding at my mother's house come get me right away<endline>Right away<endline>I have no intention of paying for my crimes don't fear<endline>We're gonna get the next plane outer here and fly away<endline>Fly away<endline><endline>And I don't feel bad about it<endline>See baby there was this struggle<endline>And I don't feel bad about it<endline>As a result of our struggle<endline>And I don't feel bad about it<endline>But the good thing is<endline>And I don't feel bad about it<endline>We don't have to struggle no more<endline><endline>With a suitcase full of money<endline>We flew to a Jamaican paradise<endline>One thing I've learned through all of this is<endline>Having money sure is nice<endline><endline>Me and my baby got married<endline>He's working hard to make his dreams came true<endline>As far as regrets I don't have any<endline>Would you?<endline>I've committed murder and I think I got away<endline>I'm hiding at my mother's house come get me right away<endline>Right away<endline>I have no intention of paying for my crimes don't fear<endline>We're gonna get the next plane outer here and fly away<endline>Fly away

songs.title: Kalifornia
songs.lyrics: {*singing*}<endline>This is the place... where you say<endline><endline>{*talking*}<endline>People come from far, far, far away to find their dreams<endline>Chasin' down these meteors and comets<endline>(chasin' 'em, chasin' 'em, chasin' 'em down)<endline>Called dreams, in the sky of life<endline>(chasin' 'em, chasin' 'em, chasin' 'em down<endline>Chasin' 'em, chasin' 'em) There certain hot spots<endline>Where these meteors and stars have tendency to fall<endline>And legend has it that California is one of those spots<endline>I believe that to be true<endline><endline>{*singing*}<endline>They say this is the place stars are born<endline>They say this is the place (place) legends are made<endline>They say this is the place where angels come again, ay ay<endline>They say that this is the place where it all can happen for you<endline>(for you, for you, for you)<endline>California knows how to make dreams seem so sweet<endline>California knows how to-<endline>Whisper in your ear and tell ya you're a star<endline>You're a star, you're a star, you're a star, you're a star (star)<endline>You're a star and you keep on shinin'<endline>(you're a star, you're a star, you're a star, you're a star)<endline>Pretty girls by the oceanside (side)<endline>Stars that refuse to shine (shine, shine)<endline>This is on your mind (i-i-i-ind-i)<endline>California knows how to party (indeed)<endline>In the city of L.A. (ay ay ay ay ay ay ay)<endline>They say that angels come again<endline>In the city, city of Compton (Compton, Compton, Compton, Compton)<endline>Black people all over the ?other side?<endline>In the city of good ol' Watts (Watts, Watts, Watts, Watts, Watts)<endline>Make them stop, make them stop<endline>In the city, California don't stop (don't stop)<endline>All the way from L.A. to the Bay (indeed)<endline>Stars fall down here, that's what they say (indeed)<endline>All the way from L.A. to the Bay (indeed)<endline>Stars fall down here, that's what they say (indeed)<endline>It's everything they say, it's everything they say<endline>Distant lights from across the Bay<endline>California! It's the C-A-L-I-F-O-R-N-I-A<endline>California knows how to make me smile sometime<endline>Yes they do (woo) yes they do<endline>California-hey-ay knows how to do what they do<endline>When they do what they do<endline>When they do what they do to me and you too, hey-ay<endline>California-how-hey-ay-ay (phenomenon, phenomenon)<endline>Worldwide original style (indeed)<endline>Mos Def on the profile (indeed)<endline>Adamsville droppin' you so very well<endline>Worlwide original style (indeed)<endline>Mos Def on the profile (indeed)<endline>Adamsville rockin' you so very well<endline>Worldwide original style (indeed)<endline>Mos Def on the profile (indeed)<endline>Adamsville rockin' you so very well (indeed)<endline>Worldwide original style (indeed)<endline>Mos Def on the profile (indeed)<endline>Adamsville rockin' you so very well (woo)<endline>In the city of L.A. (ay ay ay ay ay ay ay)<endline>It's everything they say, it's everything they say<endline>It's everything they say, it's everything they say<endline>It's everything they say

songs.title: Know That
songs.lyrics: [Mos Def]<endline>I Strike the Empire Back<endline>I Strike the Empire Back<endline>Fuck the Empire<endline>High flying like the Millenium Falcon<endline>Piloted by Han Solo<endline>I never roll for dolo, fronting on me's a no-no<endline>Understand, doing this for my family<endline>Ha ha, check it out y'all<endline><endline>Yo I'm trying to make a dollar out of what makes sense<endline>Add it up, told my daddy I'd be a rich man<endline>You never know when your fate gon' switch hand<endline>Get today's solid ground out of yesterday's quicksand<endline>I was a young boy who dreamt about being a big man<endline>On small looseleaf sheets I sketched a big plan<endline>Gotta handle business properly, boost up my economy<endline>Store it up and get my mom some waterfront property<endline>Yesterday was not for me but nowaday it's time for me<endline>The streets is watching me, I watch back that's the policy<endline>Moving along my odyssey like blood through the artery<endline>Navigate the treacherous and make it seem effortless<endline>Let those who make the exodus seekin the North beacon<endline>From beating and hog-eating, from punishment all season<endline>From hands cracked and bleeding, cotton thorns in your palms<endline>It's for y'all that I sketch these songs, and it goes<endline>Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow<endline>I fear no man, because faith is the arrow<endline>My vocal chord travel worldwide to block narrow<endline>We can blow with the ammo or go mano-a-mano<endline>Kweli is you with me (What up, what up)<endline>Let's make it happen<endline>I burn through your argument with action<endline>My eyes stay fastened to tomorrow looking for a brighter day<endline>When y'all wanna leave y'all<endline>Right away<endline><endline>Shout it out from East-West (from South to Northern)<endline>From Cackalack (to California)<endline>From the coldest (to the warmest)<endline>To the borders ('cross the waters) understand..<endline>".. and know that I love you.."<endline>We got love in the place<endline>Shout out to all the Queens (all the Seeds)<endline>To all the teams (that's gettin cream)<endline>From outlaw (to emcees)<endline>Make it happen (do your thing) understand..<endline>".. and know that I love you.."<endline>Ladies and gentlemen, ladies and gentlemen, ladies and gentlemen<endline><endline>[Mos Def]<endline>Shout it out from East-West<endline>(From South to Northern)<endline>From the richest (to the poorest)<endline>To the elders (in the coffins)<endline>Living native (dying for it) understand<endline>And know that I love you<endline>Yea, yea, we got love in the place<endline>Shout out from up top (to the middle)<endline>To black bottom (sky high!)<endline>Whether you colder than December<endline>Or hotter than July<endline>It don't stop til we complete this<endline>And know that I love you<endline>Keep this fly<endline>It's so much to life when you just<endline>Stay black<endline>My people, my people

songs.title: Let’s Go
songs.lyrics: ? the path, the path chose me<endline>This Allah's plan, divine degree<endline>Natural high, window sheet<endline>Up parallel view let the ghetto see<endline>BK home to, no LA<endline>All about that G-O-D, Amazing Grace<endline>Hater whispers, blah blah blah<endline>You too serious for nothing, hardy har<endline>But it's no joke, with a winning smile<endline>And one voice, with many styles<endline>Been fresh, get fresh, see who fresher now<endline>Strong bow, ox flow, watch it pull a plow<endline>I'm goin in, they out of luck<endline>Na sucker is there another, hit one o one<endline>Cause of it,  the December slim<endline>Block going first, I am him<endline>This rap authentic, it's not a gimmick<endline>Who went dumb and stay dumb, lord forgive him<endline>I don't mind the cynics, I mind my business<endline>Stay way above the game, that ass clever<endline><endline>Super mathematics<endline>Now that probably known for that O block<endline>So sign a waiver to that old rock<endline>Super smart, hand crafted art, decided on they know lot<endline>Flow tougher than tough town, blacker than the ground they jump round<endline>Overdose I'm over woke, be awake from crunch time<endline>Be everywhere like sunshine<endline>Leap right across, punchline<endline>I beat the track, I eat the track, but I don't pay for breakfast<endline>Lunch time<endline>Dinner date, desert tray, Ramadan<endline>Flow hungry, you see the sign between the line<endline>That jeans only, no ?<endline>I flow lovely, they go lovely<endline>They catch feelings, these hoes touch me<endline>I tell that ho like don't bunch me<endline>Home awakening, like home study<endline>But you so perdy, best of show<endline>Tryin find the best way to touch it, let's go<endline><endline>

songs.title: Life In Marvelous Times
songs.lyrics: [Mos Def]<endline>Bright moments, bright moments always come back vivid<endline>The fifth grade was epic city-wide test pressure<endline>The pre-crack era<endline>Mr. Schumer, what a prick<endline>Attitude match his wardrobe, uglier than sin<endline>This is Bed-Stuy eighty-two<endline>Ninth floor, three tiny rooms, one view<endline>Bucktown, Roosevelt House<endline>Their green grass is green; our green grass is brown<endline>Shots rang, my phone wasn't touch tone<endline>Were heavy beef in the street, E.T. had to flee<endline>Great heavens, good grief<endline>Hungry bellies, bright gold on their teeth<endline>The windows on the Ave look like sad eyes<endline>They fix their sharp gaze on you when you pass by<endline>And if you dare to stand, you can see 'em cry<endline>You can watch 'em scowl, feel 'em prowl<endline>While they're steady sizing every inch about you<endline>Fast math measuring what you amount to<endline>The laughter, the screams<endline>The numeral, the song of songs, the book of dreams<endline>Ends don't meet where the arms can't reach<endline>Mean streets, even when it's free it ain't cheap<endline>On-going saga, terminal diagnosis<endline>Basic survival requires super heroics<endline>No space in the budget for a cape<endline>Assume you gotta fly by night to save the day<endline>Crash-landings routinely happen<endline>Some survive, others never rise from the ashes<endline>Watching asphalt and observing the Sabbath<endline>Creates an Ecstatic and there you have it<endline>From teenage love praying in tongue<endline>Strange fruit, batty boots and native drums<endline>From hence I come, so here we go<endline>Signs and wonders all along the road<endline>Some lies open, some lies closed<endline>Some stretchers role with no lies at all<endline>Some riders don't know what they ridin' for<endline>Hands on the wheel and their mind is gone<endline>Wherever you ride, whatever your lane<endline>This road called life is a beautiful thing<endline>And we are alive in amazing times<endline>Delicate hearts, diabolical minds<endline>Revelations, hatred, love and war<endline>And more and more and more and more<endline>And more of less than ever before<endline>It's just too much more for your mind to absorb<endline>It's scary like hell, but there's no doubt<endline>We can't be alive in no time but NOW<endline><endline>It's just another shot to the heart<endline>It's just a sure shot in the dark<endline>It's just another place in the stars<endline>Wonders on every side, life in marvelous times<endline>Life in marvelous times<endline>Hey! The Ecstatic<endline>The temperature's rising everywhere<endline>All over the world, you can feel it<endline>All over the world, feel it<endline>Spirits rise everywhere<endline>It's just a sure shot to the heart<endline>It's just a sure shot in the dark<endline>It's just another place in the stars<endline>Wonders on every side, life in marvelous times<endline>Life in marvelous times<endline>Now, always

songs.title: Life is Real
songs.lyrics: Listen<endline>My whole life is real, morning news and nights is real<endline>What I spit and I write is real, cuz my life is real<endline>My own life is ILL!!<endline>Filled with magic's strife to scale<endline>Sun bright, no time to chill, got all type of bills<endline>I got seeds I gotta feed with this<endline>They be needin shit, I got ex-wife beef and shit<endline>That's how deep it get<endline>My whole life is real, my whole life is ill<endline>A fantastic, a beautiful mess<endline>And life nigga in America: the usual stress<endline>I do it to the up, low, the east and the west, I<endline>Do it to most, I do it to death<endline>I do so it good they don't know what to do with theyselves<endline>Well do this: MOVE!<endline>Back, forward, mo'<endline>Life is real, let's move on<endline><endline>[Mos Def]<endline>My whole life is ill, my whole life is real<endline>Mornings, noon's, nights<endline>Birthdays, workdays, holidays, funerals. the usual<endline>Life is real!<endline>Sunday to Monday, school, your gunplay, politics, bullshit<endline>Life is real!<endline>Shootings, stabbing, free tray, arrest<endline>Crush, kill, destroy, cheques<endline>Death. rebirth<endline>Reach the world but touch the street first<endline>Life goin in every direction but rewind<endline>Niggas is waiting for the light to dive down<endline>On a park a hustler plays the hide out<endline>Somebody's gotta notice it's a matter of time before the world fine out<endline>The earth dry out and push the hintin to high ground,life style--Hostile<endline>Real, life real real<endline>So real, too real, news real--edited<endline>The close up block out the rest of it<endline>True evident, false measurement<endline>Crunk superstar, thug president<endline>Tricks allegiance, M-def payment ship<endline>Scribe lively, so timely,that is timeless<endline>And is lovely, and is ugly, as it must be<endline><endline>Boogie man!

songs.title: Lifetime
songs.lyrics: The summit, the peaks<endline>The plains and the valley<endline>The ballad, the fog, the bank with the alley<endline>The waking hour, the moment, the dream<endline>The moaning, the murmur, the laughter, the scream<endline>The thrilling beginning, the quiet finale<endline>Eh eh eh eh lifetime, lifetime<endline>Keep keeping on<endline>Maintain the rock, keep up the rock<endline><endline>The lights in the plaza meant there's something fantastic<endline>The moment I met you, the first look was like magic<endline>Yeah, there's the way that it is and the way that it feels<endline>There's the distance between the ideal and the bills<endline>Yet, I see all the numbers; I still root for the dreamer<endline>I thank God for the dreamers, lifetime (2x) keep keeping on<endline>Maintain the rock, keep up the rock<endline>Maintain the spot, keep up the block<endline>Maintain the rock, keep up the rock<endline><endline>Ehhh<endline>I know this much is true<endline>We don't wanna be lonely<endline>Whether kind or you're cruel, be you noble or lowly<endline>The riot is easy and the silence is loud<endline>You can build yourself up by just turning things down<endline>We were fashioned in love, so why should we feel lonely?<endline>When forever is only... Lifetime(2x)<endline>Keep keeping on<endline>Maintain the rock, keep up the block<endline>Maintain the rock, keep up the rock<endline>Lifetime (13x) (various tones)

songs.title: Love
songs.lyrics: My pop said he was in love when he made me<endline>Thought about it for a second wasn't hard to see<endline>I could hear he was sincere, wasn't game or promotion<endline>The entire affair's probably charged with emotion<endline>When love call your heart I guess you gotta pursue<endline>12-11-73, my life is testament<endline>Praise the beneficent<endline>Element that breath<endline>Devoid in the form that make love manifest<endline>I spent my early years in Roosevelt Projects<endline>It was a bright valley with some dark prospects<endline>In '83, Vendy C was the host with the most<endline>I listened to the Rap Attack and held the radio close<endline>I listened to the Rap Attack and held the radio close<endline>This is far before the days of high glamour and pose<endline>Ayo, power from the streetlight made the place dark<endline>I know a few understand what I'm talking about<endline>It was love for the thing that made me wanna stay out<endline>It was love for the thing that made me stay in the house<endline>Spending time, writing rhymes<endline>Trying to find words that describe the vibe<endline>That's inside the space<endline>When you close your eyes and screw your face (close your eyes)<endline>Is this the pain of too much tenderness<endline>To make me nod my head in reverence?<endline>Should I visit this place in remembrance?<endline>Or build landmarks here as evidence?<endline>Nighttime, spirit shook my temperament<endline>To write rhymes that portray this sentiment<endline>We live the now for the promise of the infinite<endline>We live the now for the promise of the infinite<endline>And we believe in the promise<endline>(love x10)<endline><endline>Yes yes y'all, and we don't stop because...<endline><endline>[Refrain]<endline>Check it out y'all (uh), feel me out y'all (say what)<endline>Feel me out y'all (yeah), hear me out y'all (get down)<endline>Check me, out y'all (uh, get down, get down)<endline>Feel me out y'all (down, down), check it out y'all<endline>Now hear out (bounce) y'all<endline>Check me out y'all (uh), feel me out y'all (outside the world)<endline>Check me out y'all, feel me out y'all<endline>Feel me out y'all (hear me bounce y'all) (get down)<endline>Check me out y'all, check it out y'all<endline><endline>My folks said they was in love when they made me<endline>I take the love they made me with to make rhymes and beats<endline>(Can you feel?) The raw deal is all-wheel driven (right)<endline>Contemplate the essence of beats, rhymes and livin'<endline>Speech align with the rhythm (right), designed with the rhythm<endline>Ears and eyes keep in good time with the rhythm<endline>I shine with the rhythm, the Black Star Galactica<endline>You're big number fatin', we ancient like the abacus<endline>After us, I see most proceed to be trees<endline>Sprouting leaves, givin' breeze to the we who believe<endline>I M.C., which means I Must Cultivate the Earth<endline>Straight back, straight back, heartbeats and hard work<endline>I be the "Funky Drummer" to soften the hard Earth<endline>(Amin) Pray Allah keep my soul and heart clean<endline>(Amin) Pray the same thing again for all my team<endline>From Restoration to Fort Greene, and on out to Queens<endline>Uptown To Booggiedown, yo just look around<endline>Shook up the world like Ali in 6-3 (right)<endline>I'm reaching a height that you said cannot be<endline>I'm bringing a light which you said we can't see<endline>Saw the new day comin', it look just like me<endline>Sun bursts through the clouds, my photo ID<endline>I bring light to your day and raise your degree<endline>The universal magnetic, you must respect it<endline>From end to beginning: bright, true and living<endline>Ever changing but sustaining magnificent<endline>Building the now for the promise of the infinite<endline>Building the now for the promise of the infinite<endline>Because...<endline><endline>

songs.title: Mathematics
songs.lyrics: Yo, check it<endline>1 for Charlie Hustle, 2 for Steady Rock<endline>3 for the forth-coming live future shock<endline>It's 5 dimensions, 6 senses<endline>7 firmaments of heaven and hell<endline>8 million stories to tell<endline>9 planets faithfully keepin' orbit, with the probable 10th<endline>The universe expands length<endline>The body of my text possess extra strength<endline>Power-lift the powerless up out of this towering inferno<endline>My ink so hot it burn through the journal<endline>I'm blacker than midnight on Broadway and Myrtle<endline>Hip-Hop passed all your tall social hurdles<endline>Like the nationwide projects-prison-industry complex<endline>Working-class poor, better keep your alarm set<endline>Streets too loud to ever hear freedom ring<endline>Say evacuate your sleep, it's dangerous to dream<endline>For ch-ching, cats get the "cha-pow!" You dead now<endline>Killing fields need blood to graze the cash cow<endline>It's a numbers game, but shit don't add up somehow<endline>Like I got 16 to 32 bars to rock it<endline>But only 15% of profits ever see my pockets<endline>Like 69 billion in the last 20 years<endline>Spent on national defense, but folks still live in fear<endline>Like nearly half of America's largest cities is one-quarter black<endline>That's why they gave Ricky Ross all the crack<endline>16 ounces to a pound, 20 more to a ki<endline>A 5 minute sentence hearing and you're no longer free<endline>40% of Americans own a cell phone<endline>So they can hear everything that you say when you ain't home<endline>I guess Michael Jackson was right, you are not alone<endline>Rock your hardhat, black, 'cause you in the Terrordome<endline>Full of hard niggas, large niggas, dice-tumblers<endline>Young teens and prison greens facing life numbers<endline>Crack mothers, crack babies, and AIDS patients<endline>Young bloods can't spell but they could rock you in PlayStation<endline>This New Math is whipping motherfuckers' ass<endline>You want to know how to rhyme, you better learn how to add<endline>It's mathematics<endline><endline>Yo, it's 1 universal law, but 2 sides to every story<endline>3 strikes and you biddin' for life, mandatory<endline>4 MCs murdered in the last 4 years<endline>I ain't trying to be the 5th when the millennium is here<endline>Yo it's 6 million ways to die, from the 7 deadly thrills<endline>8-year-olds getting found with 9mils<endline>It's 10 PM, where your seeds at? What's the deal?<endline>He on the hill pumping krills to keep they bellies filled<endline>Light in the ass with heavy steel, sights on the pretty shit in life<endline>Young soldiers trying to earn their next stripe<endline>When the average minimum wage is $5.15<endline>You best believe you've got to find a new grind to get cream<endline>The white unemployment rate is nearly more than triple for black<endline>Some front-liners got their gun in your back<endline>Bubbling crack, jewel theft and robbery to combat poverty<endline>And end up in the global jail economy<endline>Stiffer stipulations attached to each sentence<endline>Budget cutbacks but increased police presence<endline>And even if you get out of prison still livin'<endline>Join the other 5 million under state supervision<endline>This is business; no faces, just lines and statistics<endline>From your phone, your Zip Code, to SSI digits<endline>The system break man, child, and women into figures<endline>2 columns for "Who is" and "Who ain't niggas"<endline>Numbers is hard and real and they never have feelings<endline>But you push too hard, even numbers got limits<endline>Why did one straw break the camel's back?<endline>Here's the secret<endline>The million other straws underneath it<endline>It's all mathematics<endline><endline>

latinos and even the gringos<endline><endline>Yo, check it one for Charlie Hustle<endline>Two for Steady Rock<endline>Three for the fourth coming live, future shock<endline>It's five dimensions<endline>Six senses<endline>Seven firmaments of heaven to hell<endline>8 Million Stories to tell<endline>Nine planets faithfully keep in orbit<endline>With the probable tenth<endline>The universe expands length<endline>The body of my text poses extra strength<endline>Power-lifting powerless up<endline>Out of this towering inferno<endline>My ink so hot it burn through the journal<endline>I'm blacker than midnight on Broadway and Myrtle<endline>Hip-Hop past all your tall social hurdles<endline>Like the nationwide projects<endline>Prison-industry complex<endline>Broken glass wall better keep your alarm set<endline>Streets too loud to ever hear freedom ring<endline>Say evacuate your sleep<endline>It's dangerous to dream<endline>But you chain cats get they CHA-POW<endline>Who dead now<endline>Killing fields need blood to graze the cash cow<endline>It's a number game<endline>But shit don't add up somehow<endline>Like I got, sixteen to thirty-two bars to rock it<endline>But only 15% of profits, ever see my pockets like<endline>Sixty-nine billion in the last twenty years<endline>Spent on national defense<endline>But folks still live in fear like<endline>Nearly half of America's largest cities<endline>Is one-quarter black<endline>That's why they gave Ricky Ross all the crack<endline>Sixteen ounces to a pound, twenty more to a key<endline>A five minute sentence hearing and you no longer free<endline>40% of Americans own a cell phone<endline>So they can hear<endline>Everything that you say when you ain't home<endline>I guess, Michael Jackson was right, "You Are Not Alone"<endline>Rock your hardhat black cause you in the Terrordome<endline>Full of hard niggas, large niggas, dice tumblers<endline>Young teens and prison greens facing life numbers<endline>Crack mothers, crack babies and AIDS patients<endline>Young bloods can't spell<endline>But they could rock you in PlayStation<endline>This new math is whipping motherfuckers ass<endline>You wanna know how to rhyme<endline>You better learn how to add<endline>It's mathematics<endline><endline>[Mos Def]<endline>Yo, it's one universal law<endline>But two sides to every story<endline>Three strikes and you be in for life<endline>Mandatory<endline>Four MC's murdered in the last four years<endline>I ain't trying to be the fifth one<endline>The millennium is here<endline>Yo it's 6 Million Ways to Die<endline>From the seven deadly thrills<endline>Eight-year olds getting<endline>Found with 9 mill's<endline>It's 10 P.M., where your seeds at?<endline>What's the deal<endline>He on the hill puffin krill<endline>To keep they belly filled<endline>Light in the ass with heavy steel<endline>Sights on the pretty shit in life<endline>Young soldiers trying to earn they next stripe<endline>When the average minimum wage is $5.15<endline>You best believe you gotta find a new ground to get cream<endline>The white unemployment rate, is nearly more than triple for black<endline>So front-liners got they gun in your back<endline>Bubbling crack<endline>Jewel theft and robbery to combat poverty<endline>And end up in the global jail economy<endline>Stiffer stipulations attached to each sentence<endline>Budget cutbacks but increased police presence<endline>And even if you get out of prison still living<endline>Join the other five million under state supervision<endline>This is business, no faces just lines and statistics<endline>From your phone, your zip code, to S-S-I digits<endline>The system break man child and women into figures<endline>Two columns for who is, and who ain't niggas<endline>Numbers is hardly real and they never have feelings<endline>But you push too hard, even numbers got limits<endline>Why did one straw break the camel's back? Here's the secret:<endline>The million other straws underneath it<endline>It's all mathematics<endline><endline>

songs.title: Maybellene
songs.lyrics: Maybellene, why can't you be true?<endline>Oh Maybellene, why can't you be true?<endline>You've started back doing<endline>The things you used to do<endline><endline>As I was motivatin' over the hill<endline>I saw Maybellenein a coup de ville<endline>A Cadillac a-rollin' on the open road<endline>Nothin' will outrun my V8 Ford<endline>The cadillac doin' 'bout ninety-five<endline>She's bumper to bumber<endline>Rollin' side by side<endline><endline>Pink in the mirror on top of the hill<endline>It's just like swallowin' up<endline>A medicine pill<endline>First thing I saw that Cadillac grille<endline>Doin' a hundred<endline>And ten gallopin' over that hill<endline>Offhill curve, a downhill stretch<endline>Me and that Cadillac neck by neck<endline><endline>

How it goes...<endline><endline>[Mos Def Rapping]<endline><endline>Mother, mother...<endline>Head in her hands<endline>Her first born son dead in her hands<endline>The whole thing was a setup, a scam<endline>They knew it was set up and planned<endline>Niggas he worked with wet him and ran, and that's..<endline>Brother, Brother...<endline>But son, I don't see no brother hood<endline>All I see is thugger hood<endline>Get rich and fuck the hood<endline>All they want is some good smoke from the hood<endline>Lookin for the shorty good stroke from the hood<endline>That's how they touch the hood<endline>But when I touch the hood, I'll make it brighter, black<endline>Because I'm brighter, black<endline>And I'm so black I'm bright, shine through the blackest night<endline>Shine when I'm live, shine via satellite<endline>Shout in the hood, we get the picture<endline>Cuz everytime you out in the hood, you got photographers witcha<endline>What's going on? songs.title: Mr. Nigga
songs.lyrics: He under thirty years old but already he's a pro<endline>Designer trousers slung low cause his pockets stay swoll'<endline>Could afford to get up and be anywhere he go<endline>V.I.P. at the club, backstage at the show<endline>(Yes y'all) the best crib, the best clothes<endline>Hottest whips on the road neck and wrists on froze (say word)<endline>Checks with Os, o-o-o-o-ohs<endline>Straight all across the globe, watch got three time-zones<endline>Keep the digital phone up to his dome<endline>Two assistants, two bank accounts, two homes<endline>One problem; even with the Os on his check<endline>The po-po stop him and show no respect<endline>"Is there a problem officer?" Damn straight, it's called race<endline>That motivate the jake (woo-woo) to give chase<endline>Say they want you successful, but that ain't the case<endline>You living large, your skin is dark, they flash a light in your face<endline><endline>Yo, the Abstract with the Mighty Mos Def<endline>White folks gotta mumble the chorus beneath they breath<endline>(I didn't say it!)<endline>But they'll say it out loud again<endline>When they get with they close associates and friends<endline>You know, sneak it in with they friends at the job<endline>Happy hour at the bar, while this song is in they car<endline>And even if they've never said it, lips stay sealed<endline>They actions reveal how their hearts really feel<endline>Like, late night I'm on a first class flight<endline>The only brother in sight, the flight attendant catch fright<endline>I sit down in my seat, 2C<endline>She approach officially, talking about, "Excuse me"<endline>Her lips curl up into a tight space<endline>Cause she don't believe that I'm in the right place<endline>Showed her my boarding pass, and then she sort of gasped<endline>All embarrassed, put an extra lime on my water glass<endline>An hour later here she come by, walkin' past<endline>"I hate to be a pest but my son would love your autograph"<endline>(Wowwww.. Mr. Nigga I love you, I have all your albums!..)<endline>They stay on nigga patrol on American roads<endline>And when you travel abroad they got world nigga law<endline>Some folks get on a plane, go where they please<endline>But I go over seas and I get over-seized<endline>London, Heathrow, me and my people<endline>They think that illegal's a synonym for negro<endline>Far away places, customs agents flagrant<endline>They think the dark faces smuggle weight in they cases<endline>Bags inspected, now we arrested<endline>Attention directed to contents of our intestines<endline>Urinalyis followed by X-rays<endline>Interrogated and detained 'til damn near the next day<endline>No evidence, no apology, and no regard<endline>Even for the big American rap star<endline>For us especially, us most especially<endline>A Mr. Nigga VIP jail cell, just for me<endline>(If I knew you were coming I'd have baked a cake)<endline>Just got some shoe-polish, painted my face<endline>They say they want you successful, but then they make it stressful<endline>You start keeping pace, they start changing up the tempo<endline><endline>You can laugh and criticize Michael Jackson if you wanna<endline>Woody Allen molested and married his step-daughter<endline>Same press kicking dirt on Michael's name<endline>Show Woody and Soon-Yi at the playoff game (holding hands)<endline>Sit back and just bug, think about that<endline>Would he get that type of dap if his name was Woody Black?<endline>O.J. found innocent by jury of his peers<endline>And they been fucking with that nigga for the last five years<endline>Is it fair, is it equal, is it just, is it right?<endline>Do you do the same shit when the defendant face is white?<endline>If white boys doing it, well, it's success<endline>When I start doing, well, it's suspect<endline>Don't hate me, my folks is poor, I just got money<endline>America's five centuries deep in cotton money<endline>You see a lot of brothers caked up, yo straight up<endline>It's new, y'all livin off of slave traders' paper<endline>But I'm a live though, yo I'm a live though<endline>I'm puttin up the big swing for my kids, yo<endline>Got my mom the fat water-front crib, yo<endline>I'm a get her them pretty bay windows<endline>I'm a cop a nice home to provide in<endline>A safe environment for seeds to reside in<endline>A fresh whip for my whole family to ride in<endline>And if I'm still Mr. Nigga, I won't find it suprisin'

songs.title: Ms. Fat Booty
songs.lyrics: In she came with the same type game<endline>The type of girl giving out the fake cell phone and name<endline>Big fame, she like cats with big things<endline>Jewels chipped, money clip, phone flip, the six range<endline>I seen her on the Ave, spotted her more than once<endline>Ass so fat that you could see it from the front<endline>She spot me like paparazzi, shot me a glance<endline>In that catwoman stance with the fat booty pants, hot damn!<endline>What's your name love, where you came from?<endline>Neck and wrist laced up, very little make-up<endline>The swims at the Reebok gym tone your frame up<endline>Is sugar and spice the only thing that you made of?<endline>I tried to play it low key, but couldn't keep it down<endline>Asked her to dance and she was like, "Yo, I'm leaving now"<endline>An hour later, sounds from Jamaica<endline>She's sipping Cris straight up, skanking, winding her waist up<endline>Scene 2 - my fam's throwing a jam<endline>Fareed is on the stand, big things is in the plans<endline>The brother Big Mu makes space for me to move<endline>"Ayo, this my man Mos, baby, let me introduce"<endline>I turned around (Say word!) it was the same pretty bird<endline>Who I had priorly observed trying to play me for the herb (Yeah, that's her)<endline>Shocked as hell she couldn't get it together<endline>I just played along and pretended I never met her<endline>How you feeling? "Oh, I'm fine" My name is Mos "I'm Sharice"<endline>I heard so much good about you, it's nice to finally meet<endline>We moved to the booth reserved for crew especially<endline>And honey love ended up sitting directly next to me<endline>I'm type polite but now I'm looking at her skeptically<endline>Cause baby girl got all the right weaponry<endline>Designer fabric, shoes and accessories<endline>Chinky eyes, sweet voice is fucking with me mentally<endline>We conversated, made her laugh, yeah, you know me bro<endline>Even though I know the steelo, she wild sweet, yo<endline>I'm 'bout to murk, I say peace to the family<endline>She hop up like, "How you gon' leave before you dance with me?"<endline><endline>Yo, let me apologize for the other night<endline>I know it wasn't right, but baby you know what it's like<endline>Some brothers don't be coming right, I understand, I'm feeling you<endline>Besides, can I have a dance ain't really that original<endline>We laughed about it, traced her arms across my shoulder blades<endline>They playing Lovers Rock, I got the folded fingers on her waist<endline>Heating my blood up like the Arizona summer<endline>Song finished then she whispered, "Honey, let's exchange numbers"<endline>Scene 3 - weeks of dating late night conversation<endline>In the crib heart racing, trying to be cool and patient<endline>She touched on my eyelids, the room fell silent<endline>She walked away smiling, singing Gregory Isaacs<endline>Like, "If I don't, if I don't have you"<endline>Showing me her tan line and her tattoo<endline>Playing Sade, Sweetest Taboo<endline>Burning candles, all my other plans got cancelled<endline>Man I smashed it like a Idaho potato<endline>She call me at my J.O., come now, I can't say no<endline>Ginseng tree trunks, rocking the P-funk<endline>Cocking her knees up, champion lover not ease up<endline>Three months, she call I feel I'm running a fever<endline>Six months, I'm telling her I desperately need her<endline>Nine months, flu-like symptoms when shorty not around<endline>I need more than to knock it down, I'm really trying to lock it down<endline>Midnight we hook up and go at it<endline>Burn a stoge and let her know, sweetheart I got to have it<endline>She telling me commitment is something she can't manage<endline>Wake up the next morning, she gone like it was magic<endline>Ahh, damn it, my shit is on Harrison Ford Frantic<endline>My 911's unanswered by my fly Taurus enchantress<endline>Next week, Mu hit me up, I saw Sharice at the Kittie club<endline>With some banging ass Asian playing lay it down and lick me up<endline>What!?

songs.title: Ms. Fat Booty 2

If you don't have the V.I.P. lacq' out<endline>Them big dollars they talk 'bout, just turn around and walk out<endline>You better watch out! Exotic fabrics, speech in larynx<endline>Think it's mid-day traffic, runnin game like the Mavericks<endline>Makin time seem elastic when we stretch out and smash it<endline>Then vanish like a phantom and hurt my understandin like WHAT??<endline><endline>(sung)<endline>.. forget<endline>I know, I can't afford to stop<endline>For a moment.. that it's too soon.. to forget<endline>I know, I can't afford to stop<endline>For a moment.. that it's too soon.. to forget<endline>I know, I can't afford to stop<endline>For a moment.. that it's too soon.. to forget<endline>{*music gradually fades out*}<endline><endline>[Mos Def] - speaking over sung vocals<endline>Special, special dedication<endline>To all the fine-ass ghetto troublemakers, out in the world today<endline>Some in this very party right here right now tonight<endline>Some of them listenin to this song in they jeeps<endline>Some of them listenin to this song at they job<endline>Some of them runnin game on some cat right now<endline>I want you to just rock and bounce to that<endline>Rock and bounce to that<endline><endline>{*music comes back in*}<endline><endline>[Mos Def]<endline>I say girls, girls, girls, girls<endline>Reach out and clap your hands<endline>I be the fabulous man so, just play the fabulous fan<endline>And, bring the breeze, bring the breeze<endline>Say girls, girls, girls, girls<endline>Reach out and clap your hands<endline>I be the fabulous man so, just play the fabulous fan<endline>And, bring the breeze, bring the breeze<endline>{*music and vocals fade*}

songs.title: Ms. Fat Booty - (best of decade I version)
songs.lyrics: I know I can't afford to stop<endline>For one moment, that it's too soon to forget<endline><endline>Man, duke I was in love with this girl, duke<endline>I was tore up dog, I'm telling you man<endline>Shit is wild man, for real<endline>It's, she's from, let me tell you about her<endline><endline>In she came with the same type game<endline>The type of girl giving out the fake cell phone and name<endline>Big fame, she like cats with big things<endline>Jewels chipped, money clip, phone flip, the six range<endline>I seen her on the Ave, spotted her more than once<endline>Ass so fat that you could see it from the front<endline>She spot me like paparazzi, shot me a glance<endline>In that catwoman stance with the fat booty pants, hot damn!<endline>What's your name love, where you came from?<endline>Neck and wrist laced up, very little make-up<endline>The swims at the Reebok gym tone your frame up<endline>Is sugar and spice the only thing that you made of?<endline>I tried to play it low key, but couldn't keep it down<endline>Asked her to dance and she was like, "Yo, I'm leaving now"<endline>An hour later, sounds from Jamaica<endline>She sipping Cris straight up, shaking, winding her waist up<endline>Scene 2: my fam throwing the jam<endline>Fareed is on the stand, big things is in the plans<endline>The brother Big Mu makes space for me to move<endline>"Ayo, this my man Mos, baby, let me introduce"<endline>I turned around (Say word!) it was the same pretty bird<endline>Who I had priorly observed trying to play me for the herb<endline>Shocked as hell she couldn't get it together<endline>I just played along and pretended I never met her<endline>How you feeling? "Oh, I'm fine" My name is Mos "I'm Sharice"<endline>I heard so much good about you, it's nice to finally meet<endline>We moved to the booth reserved for crew especially<endline>And honey love ended up sitting directly next to me<endline>I'm type polite but now I'm looking at her skeptically<endline>Cause baby girl got all the right weaponry<endline>Designer fabric, shoes and accessories<endline>Chinky eyes, sweet voice is fucking with me mentally<endline>We conversated, made her laugh, yeah, you know me bro<endline>Even though I know the steelo, she wild sweet, yo<endline>I'm 'bout to murk, I say peace to the family<endline>She hop up like, "How you gon' leave before you dance with me?"<endline><endline>She blew my whole head with that duke, I was like, word?<endline>I played it low though, I was like, yeah, aight, come on then, let's go<endline>Niggas was mad, niggas was so sick, I tell ya<endline>Yo, honey was so blazing she was just<endline>Yo, she looked like Jayne Kennedy, word bond, to my mother man<endline>She was that ill man, she take me to the dance floor<endline>And she start whispering to me and shit<endline><endline>"Yo, let me apologize for the other night<endline>I know it wasn't right, but baby you know what it's like<endline>Some brothers don't be coming right, I understand, I'm feeling you<endline>Besides, can I have a dance ain't really that original"<endline>We laughed about it, traced her arms across my shoulder blades<endline>They playing Lovers Rock, I got the folded fingers on her waist<endline>Heating my blood up like the Arizona summer<endline>Song finished then she whispered, "Honey, let's exchange numbers"<endline>Scene 3: weeks of dating late night conversation<endline>In the crib heart racing, trying to be cool and patient<endline>She touched on my eyelids, the room fell silent<endline>She walked away smiling, singing Gregory Isaacs<endline>Like, "If I don't, if I don't have you"<endline>Showing me her tan line and her tattoo<endline>Playing Sade, Sweetest Taboo<endline>Burning candles, all my other plans got cancelled<endline>Man I smashed it like a Idaho potato<endline>She call me at my J.O., come now, I can't say no<endline>Ginseng tree trunks, rocking the P-funk<endline>Cocking her knees up, champion lover not ease up<endline>Three months, she call I feel I'm running a fever<endline>Six months, I'm telling her I desperately need her<endline>Nine months, flu-like symptoms when shorty not around<endline>I need more than to knock it down, I'm really trying to lock it down<endline>Midnight we hook up and go at it<endline>Burn a stoge and let her know, sweetheart I got to have it<endline>She telling me commitment is something she can't manage<endline>Wake up the next morning, she gone like it was magic<endline>Ahh, damn it, my shit is on Harrison Ford frantic<endline>My 911's unanswered by my fly Taurus enchantress<endline>Next week, Mu hit me up, I saw Sharice at the Kittie club<endline>With some banging ass Asian playing lay it down and lick me up<endline>What!?

songs.title: Murder of a Teenage Life
songs.lyrics: Man, what was the young blood name? Funk Crush<endline>Young blood just hungry<endline>It's no glamour, it's no glory<endline>It's no joke no game<endline>It's murder everyday, murder (Boogeyman)<endline><endline>(They shot the boy!)<endline>The murder of a teenage life<endline>Fire from the cold steel, the heat from the brights<endline>The temperature of flesh and the shortness of breath<endline>The murder of a teenage threat<endline>The aroma of sinsemilia dollar superstar<endline>Scum of vicodin cocaine tobacco leaf<endline>Ecstatic tap-less fire water and freaky-deeky-e<endline>The murder of a teenage chief<endline>My easy speaking is easy as it seem to be<endline>Hungry belly drama busts off easily<endline>Balloon bang, pop, hot as a bang spot in Bangkok<endline>Colder than a pimp Glock, aim shot the frame drops<endline>Pressure pushed him to the earth like a rain drop<endline>Take not life in vain, now how the preacher was saying<endline>Remember anyway they laid him in the straight box<endline>Dark suit and gray socks the neighborhood is all distraught<endline>Candle lights upon the news report the families and students saw<endline>Confused in awe, they weep into each others' arms<endline>It's murder<endline>New absence from a mother's arm<endline>Even the warmth from the mother's arms<endline>Could not keep her son from harm<endline>From standing where the gun was drawn<endline>Over come done and done he gone, murder<endline>Shell like a bell that rung<endline>The blood burst body temperature fell and plunged<endline>And then the time it took the medics to come<endline>The breath eased out of his lungs<endline>And his soul eased out of the slums<endline>And the voice eased out of the drums<endline>The sireens they gleam they swung, murder<endline>Telephone wire sneakers hung, murder<endline>For the black and young, murder, and the Ave they from<endline>I am from the block the president did not campaign on<endline>Where the dollar that the working poor slave for is made on<endline>Where hustlers stretch the yay long<endline>Hustle hard for an outpost to trade on<endline>Flip it over and make more<endline>Where the blocks are yellow taped off<endline>Young bloods is trained off for obese to gray zone<endline>Where the pressure just stay on<endline>But the lights and the heat don't<endline>The place where you witness the true power of street folk<endline>And that's where I'm coming from people<endline>High post low key eighth oz and kilo<endline>Law man dope man adversary amigo<endline>Preacher man pimp hand both folding their C-notes<endline>A black fist clutching deliverance for the people<endline>Young hand reach out, strong hand reach in<endline>Chop the devil's hand to make the fucker stop reaching<endline>Ghetto people know when the voice of true speaking<endline>M-Def, and foreal hold still nigga seein'<endline>I ain't got to say please, just believe it<endline>The unerasable the black ink fact<endline>Y'all fuckers know exactly how to act get back<endline>Forever black (forever black) never wack (never that)<endline>From the K (Killa K) that's that (that's that)<endline>So you can kill all the yap, murder<endline><endline>They shot the boy (3x)<endline>They kill 'em all

songs.title: Promised Land
songs.lyrics: I left my home in Norfolk Virginia<endline>California on my mind<endline>I straddled that Greyhound, rode him into Raleigh<endline>And on across to Caroline<endline><endline>Stopped in Charlotte and bypassed Rock Hill<endline>We never was a minute late<endline>We was ninety miles out of Atlanta by sundown<endline>Rollin' out of Georgia State<endline><endline>We had motor trouble<endline>It turned into a struggle half way 'cross Alabama<endline>And that 'Hound broke down and left us all stranded<endline>In downtown Birmingham<endline><endline>Right away I bought me a through train ticket<endline>Ridin' cross Mississippi Clean<endline>And I was on that midnight flyer out of Birmingham<endline>Smoking into New Orleans<endline><endline>Somebody help me get out of Louisiana<endline>Just help me get to Houston town<endline>And there're people there who care a little 'bout me<endline>And they won't let the poor boy down<endline><endline>Sure as you're born they bought me a silk suit<endline>Put luggage in my hands<endline>And I woke up high over Albuquerque<endline>On a jet to the promised land<endline><endline>Workin' on a T-bone steak a la carte<endline>Flying over to the Golden State<endline>Oh, when the pilot told me in thirteen minutes<endline>He would set us at the terminal gate<endline><endline>Swing low sweet chariot come down easy<endline>Taxi to the terminal zone<endline>Cut your engines and cool your wings<endline>And let me make it to the telephone<endline><endline>Los Angeles, give me Norfolk Virginia<endline>Tidewater, four, ten-o-nine<endline>Tell the folks back home this is the promised land callin'<endline>And the poor boy's on the line
