songs.title: Rock N Roll
songs.lyrics: [Mos Def]<endline>Make me wanna holla!<endline>"Ah.. ah-ah, ah-ah.. ah-ah, ah-lert the squad.."<endline>Rock and roll<endline><endline>(Huh) My grandmomma was raised on a reservation<endline>(Huh) My great-grandmama was, from a plantation<endline>They sang - songs for inspiration<endline>They sang - songs for relaxation<endline>They sang - songs, to take their minds up off that<endline>Fucked up situation<endline>I am, yes I am, the descendant (yes yes)<endline>Of those folks whose, backs got broke<endline>Who, fell down inside the gun smoke<endline>(Black people!) Chains on their ankles and feet<endline>I am descendants, of the builders of your street<endline>(Black people!) Tenders to your cotton money<endline>I am hip-hop<endline>"It's heavy metal for the black people"<endline>I am rock and roll (rock and roll, rock'n'roll)<endline>Been here forever<endline>They just ain't let you know (HA!)<endline><endline>I said, Elvis Presley ain't got no soul (huh)<endline>Chuck Berry is rock and roll (damn right)<endline>You may dig on the Rolling Stones<endline>But they ain't come up with that style on they own (uh-uh)<endline>Elvis Presley ain't got no soul (hell naw)<endline>Little Richard is rock and roll (damn right)<endline>You may dig on the Rolling Stones<endline>But they ain't come up with that shit on they own (nah-ah)<endline><endline>Guess that's just the way shit goes<endline>You steal my clothes and try to say they yours (yes they do)<endline>Cause it's a show filled with pimps and hoes<endline>Trying to take everything that you made or control (there they go)<endline>Elvis Presley ain't got no soul<endline>Bo Diddley is rock and roll (damn right)<endline>You may dig on the Rolling Stones<endline>But they ain't the first place the credit belongs<endline><endline>I ain't trying to diss<endline>But I don't be trying to fuck with Limp Bizkit ("The fuck is on your mind?")<endline>When I get down in my zone<endline>I be rockin Bad Brains and Fishbone<endline>I ain't tryin to slow your groove<endline>But that ain't the way I'm trying to move<endline>I don't turn on Korn to get it on;<endline>I be playing Jimi Hendrix 'til the dawn<endline>That's my word is bond<endline>Sitting up on my front lawn<endline>Got the volume turned to ten<endline>Playing Albert King the best again (black)<endline>When the morning in the cooker<endline>Got to turn on some John Lee Hooker<endline>When I want some rock and roll<endline>Go to Otis Redding to get some soul<endline><endline>Say, James Brown got plenty of soul<endline>James Brown like to rock and roll<endline>He can do all the shit fo' sho'<endline>That Elvis Presley could never know (black people)<endline>Said, Kenny G ain't got no soul<endline>John Coltrane is rock and roll (uh-huh)<endline>You may dig on the Rolling Stones<endline>But they could never ever rock like Nina Simone<endline><endline>"ah-lert the squad"<endline><endline>{*Music picks up pace and gets louder*}<endline><endline>Who am I, huh!<endline>Get your punk ass up<endline><endline>Elvis Presley ain't got no soul<endline>Jimi Hendrix is rock and roll<endline>You may dig on the Rolling Stones<endline>But everything they did they stole<endline>Elvis Presley ain't got no soul<endline>Bo Diddley is rock and roll<endline>You may dig on the Rolling Stones<endline>But we send their punk ass home<endline><endline>Who am I? (Rock and roll) (x10)<endline><endline>Say, rock and roll!<endline>Who am I? Rock and roll! (x6)<endline><endline>Get your punk ass up<endline>Company, move<endline>For Harlem, Fort Greene, Compton<endline>East St. Louis, Detroit (BO BO)<endline>Chicago (BO BO) Bed-Stuy (BO BO)<endline>Flatbush (BO BO) Brownsville (BO BO)<endline>East New York (BO BO) Newark New Jersey (BO BO)<endline>Illadelphia Cincinnati Atlanta the Dirty South<endline>All towns GET YOUR PUNK ASS UP!!<endline>"Rock and roll for the black people"<endline>Hi ma<endline><endline>"Well that was just wonderful"

songs.title: Roses
songs.lyrics: Power and grace<endline>Yellow for friendship, red for love<endline>Black for the universal stars above<endline>Pink buds that I bought her on Valentine<endline>She said it was forever then she changed her mind<endline>I said a little prayer then I cleared my eyes<endline>Cause I feel the draw on my heartstrings, drawing the line<endline>Started off with a orchid, natural portrait<endline>I ain't Picasso but that ain't important<endline>Faith, smart dude never graduated at art school<endline>Stay tuned I'm a show you how my art move<endline>Shape and dimension flow and extension<endline>Symmetry shade, blowin' out the frame<endline>Sign off my name Dante when I'm finished<endline>Put it to your memory for permanent exhibit<endline>Love, hard work and it's worth every minute<endline>Abstract is still life real life kinetic<endline><endline>[Georgia Anne Muldrow & Yasiin Bey]<endline>Got my pencil (Check one), got pretty paper (Check two, check it out)<endline>Please don't worry we're forgiven (Power and grace to creation)<endline>You don't have to (No necessary), cut up no roses (Be easy, chopper!)<endline>Please just leave them living<endline><endline>

songs.title: Soldier’s Dream
songs.lyrics: <endline>The other night<endline>I was tumbling towards an uneasy sleep<endline>Where I had discovered myself<endline>Atop the sweet sticky firmament of my dreams<endline>Daybreak came and discovered me<endline>With my fantasies pasted to my face<endline><endline>I can't look at you right now<endline>"Show me your eyes," she says<endline>"Later," he says<endline>"Now, now."<endline>"NO!"<endline><endline>Shame is a prison you know<endline>Yeah, well discretion is a fortress<endline>You’re staring and looking too closely<endline>There’s so much about me that I hide<endline>That careful eyes will recognize<endline>If you look closely you’ll notice<endline>That the pattern on this soft broadcloth shirt<endline>Is made of<endline>Working man's blood<endline>And praying folk’s tears<endline>If you look closer, you’ll notice that<endline>This pattern resembles<endline>Tenement row houses, project highrises<endline>Cell block tiers<endline>Discontinued stretches of elevated train tracks<endline>Slave ship gullies, acres of tombstones<endline>If you look closer, you’ll notice<endline>That this fabric has been carefully blended<endline>With an advanced new age polymer (oh man, that’s nice)<endline>To make the fabric lightweight<endline>Weatherproof, and durable<endline>All this<endline>To give some sort of posture and dignity<endline>To a broken body that is a host for scars<endline>I am the new landmark<endline>I am the museum of injury<endline>Soldiers visit me and admire me quietly<endline>Whispering among themselves<endline>You’re no soldier<endline>Your soft bright eyes never have to<endline>Survey the battlefield<endline>Much less its collected relics of which, I am one<endline>So, my flesh bullet-ridden remains hidden<endline>Underneath these soft fabrics<endline>Which I carefully select<endline>That stand in for how I used to feel<endline>For how I remember feeling<endline>For how I dream about feeling<endline>For how I feel about you<endline>And now your curious fingers want to search<endline>Beyond this tender armor<endline>I can't look at you right now<endline><endline>This is my rifle<endline>There are many like it<endline>But this one is mine<endline>2x<endline><endline>Your eyes are too careful<endline>Collecting it all arranging it all;<endline>Surgically, robotically, exactly<endline>I can’t look at you right now<endline>But that doesn’t matter because<endline>You can look at me and the longer that<endline>I don’t return your gaze<endline>The harder that your gaze<endline>Starts to run across my back<endline>Like a nervous policeman’s hands:<endline>Brisk, intent, anxious for discovery<endline>If discretion is a fortress<endline>Then you’re threatening to destroy it<endline>By simply<endline>Standing at the gates<endline>And refusing to leave<endline>I can’t look at you right now<endline>But you can look at me<endline>Do you see me?

songs.lyrics: Quick question...<endline>You ever felt like the realest nigga alive?<endline>Felt too pretty or powerful to die?<endline>Tell the truth...<endline>You ever felt ugly enough to cry?<endline>Have you ever begged for mercy?<endline>Have you ever wished you died?<endline>Tell the truth...<endline>Have you ever taken pride in the crime?<endline>Been too hungry to back down or hide?<endline>Felt low down dirty? Or super duper high?<endline>Or contemplated murder, robbery, or suicide?<endline>Tell the truth...<endline>Taken medicine for trouble in your mind?<endline>Or taken down a number? For taking up a scheme?<endline>I made her wild, beautiful take her 'til she skeet?<endline>Take her to the penthouse or take her to the skreet?<endline>Tell the Truth...<endline>So the waterman he take it to the beat<endline>And I take it to the 'mic<endline>So we takin' what we like<endline>Take it to your neck<endline>We gon' take it to the bank<endline>Triple X, Killa K<endline>Black we take it to your face<endline>Like, G...<endline><endline>The Dee-Jay play this song in the dance<endline>And every buggy on the block got the tune on blast<endline>The TV is like the radio with visuals too<endline>So shiny, so gutter, mean moody and cool<endline>Tell the truth...<endline>They might be doing things that you wanna' do<endline>You fantasize as they be living it through<endline>The big home with the beautiful view<endline>You have a swim in the pool, and get fresh<endline>And take a spin in the coupe<endline>Tell the truth...<endline>You probably want to feel the world in your palm<endline>While hold a gun in your hand<endline>And make 'em know you a star<endline>Tell the truth...<endline>And there's those who probably already are<endline>They well known in they zone<endline>Or they town or they block<endline>Tell the truth...<endline>Then there's the rest who are usually not<endline>And the heavy dose of thug feel like all that they got<endline>So they ready to rock...R-r-rock...<endline><endline>Ha, ha, heh<endline><endline>{*beat rides out*}

songs.title: U R the One
songs.lyrics: When it started I knew it was trouble<endline>But you know me, them "hard and everythings" can't hold me<endline>I need some shit straight out the movies<endline>Drama, warm to the touch, hot mama<endline>Put me all in like launch jeans and scama<endline>You was Mrs. Mine, so fine<endline>Went from "we gon' conquer it all"<endline>To "nigga I'mma see you in court"<endline>I woulda never thought, I guess I better think again<endline>Ok, now the shit is really sinkin' in<endline>We ain't just divorced, we ain't even fucking friends<endline>Cause in the end it was all about the ends<endline>But fuck that I know it gotta be more to it<endline>Held up with bitter hate with crosses all through it<endline>And when I looked, what did I see?<endline>You on the other end crying like me<endline>Expression on your face like, "How could this be?"<endline>That's what I'm asking, "What the fuck happened?"<endline>How could all the magic and passion just vanish<endline>Went from outsanding to making me shout, "Dammit!"<endline>Can't explain the changes, behavior's is outlandish<endline>Now I'm just stuck in the road feeling stranded<endline>I'm in the dark wishing for the answers<endline>On some old Biggie give me one more chance shit<endline>When we met your face so brown<endline>Your ass so round, of course I'm so down<endline>Wish I knew then what the fuck I know now<endline>Couldn't read the signs in the road: "Slow down!"<endline>I'm too deep in the road now<endline>Got me pulling over getting smoked out<endline>Fighting tears that I can't hold down<endline>Can't believe it, this fucka's got me weeping<endline>I keep it a secret so my friends won't peep it<endline>But late in the evening I'm up, my chest heaving<endline>I'm reaching in the dark and I'm looking for the reason<endline>Why? Did our love have to die? You and I were so fucking fly<endline>Can't get it off my mind, the things that made me smile now make me cry<endline><endline>
